description: The US must not “shy away” from exercising its influence over Israel and pushing for a cease-fire in conflicts that threaten to expand across the wider Middle East, according to a senior United Arab Emirates’ official.
title: US Must Leverage Israel Ties to Push for Cease-Fire, UAE Says

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer confirmed plans to meet with former President Donald Trump to get to know him “face-to-face” later Thursday, capping off a two-day visit to New York for the United Nations General Assembly.
title: Starmer Seeks to Build ‘Personal Relations’ in Trump Meeting

description: Smartmatic Corp. settled its defamation lawsuit against Newsmax Media Inc. over broadcasts claiming that the voting technology company rigged the 2020 presidential election against Donald Trump, resolving the matter days before a jury trial was set to begin.
title: Smartmatic, Newsmax Settle Defamation Case on Eve of Trial

description: Top House Republicans are stalling landmark US legislation that would protect children from online exploitation and bullying, bowing to criticisms from Big Tech and exposing a rift within the party over regulating social media.
title: Big Tech Taps Ties to Republican Lawmakers to Stall Child Safety Bill

description: Poverty in Argentina reached its highest level since the aftermath of the 2001 financial crisis in the first half of the year, as President Javier Milei unleashed a shock therapy program to put an already reeling economy back on its feet.
title: Poverty Soars Past 50% in Argentina as Milei Austerity Hits Hard

description: Haiti’s interim leader took a not-so-veiled swipe at Donald Trump over the Republican nominee’s amplification of unfounded conspiracy theories about immigrants.
title: Haiti’s Leader Jabs at Trump Over False Claims on Immigrants

description: A Lima bus strike that shut schools and upended hospital schedules is also shining a light on the power of Peru’s extortion gangs.
title: Crippling Bus Strike Shines Light on Peru’s Extortion Gangs

description: Ukraine has moved to restrict the draft of men over 50 years of age to address brewing public discontent over conscription, according to local media.
title: Ukraine Restricts Draft of Men Over 50 After Public Backlash

description: “Resign!” was a resounding cry on Thursday outside Gracie Mansion, the home of New York City’s mayor. The word, repeated over and over, drowned out Eric Adams as he urged New Yorkers to hear his defense before making any judgment.
title: NYC Mayor Rebels Against Charges as Adams’ Critics Cry ‘Resign!’

description: The US Treasury’s top international official welcomed fresh pledges from China’s leadership to bolster economic growth, while urging Beijing to follow up with meaningful actions.
title: US Treasury Signals China’s Stimulus Unveil Still Falls Short

description: Four years ago, Mark Testoni, an SAP SE executive, and Craig Abod, the president and founder of giant software reseller Carahsoft Technology Corp., stood at the podium of an event organized by the Institute for Excellence in Sales.
title: Carahsoft Boss Built Empire Off Government Sales Before FBI Raid

description: Nicolas Maduro’s Venezuela is not included on a list of prospective invitees to the BRICS bloc of emerging market countries that has circulated among the group’s members at the United Nations this week, according to three Brazilian officials familiar with the situation.
title: Maduro’s BRICS Invite Slips Away as Bloc Plans Another Expansion

description: The Pentagon confirmed a report that a Chinese submarine sank earlier this year, and it’s unclear if the vessel was carrying nuclear fuel.
title: Chinese Nuclear-Powered Sub Sank This Year, US Says

description: England’s drug pricing regulator declined to recommend GSK Plc’s long-acting HIV prevention injection, asking the company for more data, in a decision that further delays access to the medicine for patients in the country.
title: Access to Long-Acting HIV Prevention Drug Delayed in England

description: Canada’s industry minister says ongoing challenges to adopt an artificial intelligence framework do not look good for the country. The law may never even see the light of day if Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s minority government falls sooner than expected.
title: Canada’s Lack of AI Framework ‘Embarrassing,’ Minister Says

description: Super Micro Computer Inc. is under investigation by the US Justice Department following a short-seller report that raised questions about the company’s accounting practices, the Wall Street Journal reported.
title: Super Micro Probed by US Following Hindenburg Report, WSJ Says

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is considering tweaks to her overhaul of the UK’s tax regime for wealthy foreigners, amid concern that Labour’s current plans may end up costing revenue.
title: Reeves Mulls Tweaks to UK’s Tax Plans for ‘Non-Dom’ Foreigners

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams was indicted on bribery and fraud charges following a federal corruption investigation, calling into question the political future of the man in charge of running the biggest US city.
title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams Indicted on Bribery and Fraud Charges

description: Senate Democrats announced Thursday they are spending millions to defeat Ted Cruz in Texas and Rick Scott in Florida, where polls have shown the incumbents surprisingly vulnerable.
title: Senate Democrats Pour in Millions to Defeat Ted Cruz, Rick Scott

description: Tierra del Fuego, centro de manufacturas de electrónicos de Argentina, sufre el embate de los planes económicos del presidente.
title: La terapia de shock de Milei pone a prueba la industria al fin del mundo

description: Former Bank of Canada Governor Stephen Poloz is examining a list of ideas to get the country’s pension funds to invest more in the domestic economy – including the creation of a pooled fund that would make dealmaking easier for some of them.
title: Poloz Hears Proposals for New Fund to Pull Canada’s Pension Managers Back Home

description: Rudy Giuliani has lost his law license in Washington after a New York court disbarred him over the summer for his efforts to try to overturn the 2020 election results.
title: Rudy Giuliani Loses Washington Law License Over 2020 Actions

description: Libyan factions agreed to appoint a new central bank governor, paving the way for a resolution to a row that’s sharply cut the OPEC nation’s oil output.
title: Libya Rivals Name Central Banker in Deal That May End Oil Crisis

description: The US told the European Union that it will contribute $20 billion to a massive Group of Seven-led Ukraine aid package if the bloc tweaks its Russian sanctions regime as planned to make it more predictable.
title: US, EU Near Deal on $50 Billion Ukraine Aid Using Russian Assets

description: A senior aide to Prime Minister Viktor Orban sparked an outcry at home after calling Ukraine’s decision to defend itself against Russia’s invasion “irresponsible” and suggested that Hungary wouldn’t have taken up arms.
title: Orban Aide Sparks Outcry Suggesting Ukraine Surrender From Day 1

description: Chile has identified new lithium areas that will be offered to the private sector as authorities attempt to tap more of the world’s biggest reserves of the battery metal, despite a current glut in the global market.
title: Chile Pinpoints New Lithium Areas for Private-Sector Development

description: The mayor of South Africa’s capital was ousted on Thursday after a multiparty coalition that ruled the city collapsed.
title: Mayor of South Africa’s Capital Ousted as Coalition Collapses

description: The New York City Council will introduce legislation this week that would drastically reduce the amount of insurance coverage taxi and ride-share vehicles are required to maintain, looking to contain potential fallout from the insolvency of the city’s largest taxi insurer.
title: NYC Weighs Slashing Cab Insurance 75% to $50,000 to Aid Drivers

description: The UK has sanctioned five vessels and two entities linked to Russia’s liquefied natural gas exports, including tankers believed to have loaded at its newest export facility in the Arctic region.
title: UK Joins US in Sanctioning LNG Ships Linked to Russia Dark Fleet

description: A Hong Kong court sentenced a former editor to 21 months in prison for publishing articles about pro-democracy activists, the first jailing of a journalist on sedition charges since the former British colony returned to Chinese rule.
title: Hong Kong Editor Jailed 21 Months in First Media Sedition Case

description: Donald Trump’s lawyers are on a mission to wipe out his biggest financial liability — a nearly half-billion dollar fraud verdict that’s soaring by about $100,000 every day.
title: Trump Seeks to Wipe Out His Biggest Debt Costing $112,000 a Day

description: The high-stakes US presidential election could disrupt investor optimism in the country’s stock market after a recovery since the summer selloff, according to strategists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
title: Goldman Strategists Say US Election to Test Optimism in Stocks

description: The 2024 race has been marked by campaign-sanctioned mockery running both ways on social media.
title: How Harris’ Campaign Finally Made Biden’s Meme Strategy Work

description: The anti-‘woke’ warrior is still longing for a shot at history. The Nov. 5 presidential election will determine his next move.
title: Vivek Ramaswamy Plots His Next Move, With or Without Trump

description: Kamala Harris is likely to assemble an economic team that will seek to build ties with the business community if she wins the November election, with key policy battles looming over taxes, the debt limit and funding the federal government.
title: Harris Allies Eye Building Business Ties, With Treasury in Focus

description: President Joe Biden announced $2.4 billion in military assistance for Ukraine on Thursday and plans to convene a leader-level meeting of key allies to coordinate additional support when he visits Germany next month.
title: Biden to Convene Ukraine Allies in Germany, Surge Military Aid

description: A year ago Benjamin Netanyahu came to the United Nations touting the blessings of peace with the Arab world. He returns with the region on the brink of all-out war.
title: Netanyahu Flies From War to Diplomatic Hostility With UN Visit

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: World Ravaged by the Most Conflicts Since 1945

description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is juggling multiple diplomatic stumbles in Latin America, inflaming colonial-era tensions and threatening the region’s deepest investment relationships.
title: Sanchez’s Diplomatic Forays Are Backfiring for Spain

description: Michael Hintze has invested in a lobbying firm set up by a veteran political adviser who served as Liz Truss’s top aide during her stint as the UK’s prime minister, bolstering the hedge fund billionaire’s ties to Britain’s political elite.
title: Billionaire CQS Founder Hintze Invests in Liz Truss Aide’s Firm

description: President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris on Thursday will roll out new measures to explore ways to crack down on illegal firearm technologies, as crime and gun reform take on heightened levels of attention with just weeks until November’s election.
title: Biden, Harris Take Steps to Impede Illegal Firearm Devices

description: Bond investors are demanding a higher yield to hold French bonds than lower-rated Spanish debt for the first time since 2007, as investors question the government’s ability to plug a hole in public finances.
title: France’s Bond Yield Surpasses Spain’s for First Time Since 2007

description: Incoming Commerzbank AG Chief Executive Officer Bettina Orlopp said the lender’s leadership will have a meeting with UniCredit SpA on Friday as the Italian lender prepares a potential takeover.
title: Commerzbank Set to Have First Meeting With UniCredit Tomorrow

description: Israel kept up its bombardment of Hezbollah positions in Lebanon, as the US and its allies proposed a three-week cease-fire to allow for negotiations in a last-ditch effort to avoid full-blown war.
title: US and Allies Race to Stop Unfolding Lebanon War With Truce Plan

description: Tunisian presidential hopeful Ayachi Zammel, one of two men squaring off against President Kais Saied in Oct. 6 elections, was given another jail term on charges of falsifying records.
title: Tunisia Presidential Hopeful Gets New Prison Term Ahead of Vote

description: Somalia’s cabinet appointed Asad Osman Abdullahi as its new police commissioner.
title: Somalia Appoints Asad Osman Abdullahi as New Police Chief

description: Lebanon’s Hezbollah has shown flexibility with regards to a cease-fire with Israel, according to the nation’s economy minister, as world powers rush to prevent a full-blown war between the two.
title: Lebanon Says Hezbollah Shows Flexibility Regarding Israel Truce

description: North Korea is looking at conducting a nuclear test to coincide with the November presidential election in the US, Yonhap News reported, citing comments the South’s spy agency made to lawmakers.
title: North Korea Looking at Nuke Test Near US Vote, Spy Agency Says

description: Thailand runs a “very alarming” risk of credit rating downgrades if the government doesn’t rein in its massive pile of debt to prop up Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy, according to the country’s biggest opposition group.
title: Thailand Risks Credit Rating Downgrade as Debt Mounts, Opposition Party Warns

description: Sri Lanka’s new president took office with a mandate to bring relief to citizens still burdened by the remnants of the country’s worst-ever economic crisis. Now comes the hard part: Getting the lenders to play along.
title: Sri Lanka’s Leftist Leader Faces Tough Test to Alter IMF Deal

description: Every unhappy taxpayer is unhappy in their own way.
title: Will Britain’s Darkening Mood Make Labour a One-Hit Wonder?

description: The Prime Minister’s “business whisperer” Varun Chandra has been putting his extensive contacts book to use at the Labour party conference this week, meeting corporate networkers who hope to have the ear of the new government.
title: Starmer’s ‘Whisperer’ Brings Connections, Complications From Past

description: New Zealand faces rising debt in coming decades as an aging population exacerbates a structural budget deficit, in a major challenge for fiscal policy, a top Treasury adviser said.
title: New Zealand Treasury Concerned by Trajectory of Government Debt

description: Among the challenges awaiting Japan’s next prime minister, few will be as weighty as managing relations with its sole treaty ally the US and navigating fraying ties with China, the biggest trading partner for Tokyo.
title: Japan’s Next PM Faces Challenge of New US Leader and Tension With China

description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump plans to meet with the new UK prime minister, Keir Starmer, as well as the president of the United Arab Emirates, according to a senior adviser, as the former president continues to hold sway with foreign leaders in the shadow of the US election.
title: Trump Plans Meetings With UK’s Starmer and Leader of the UAE

description: A Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force warship passed through the Taiwan Strait on Wednesday for the first time, NHK reported, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.
title: Japan Warship Sails Through Taiwan Strait in a First, NHK Says

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has been has been indicted following a federal corruption investigation, the New York Times reported, citing people with knowledge of the matter.
title: NYC Mayor Adams Indicted After Federal Corruption Probe: NYT

description: The Pentagon praised China for its transparency before the test launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile into the Pacific Ocean, in a sign that military communication between the superpowers is improving.
title: US Hails China’s Advanced Notice of ICBM Test as ‘Good Thing’

description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris said keeping domestic control of steel production was more important than possible job losses if a proposed deal for Nippon Steel Corp., a Japanese company, to purchase United States Steel Corp. fell through.
title: Harris Says Keeping US Steel Domestic Worth Threatened Job Loss
